main event: A B-29 bombardier reported seeing an unidentified flying object near Goodland, Kansas on 29 April 1952, characterized as a white pear shape flying in straight and level flight.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 2 seconds during which it was noted to pulsate 3-4 times per second., The object was described as having a soft white light and was approximately 50 to 60 feet across., It was traveling at a high speed of approximately 1,000 mph and was completely silent., No other air traffic was observed in the area at the time of the sighting., The object was not captured by radar despite the altitude of approximately 5,000 feet.
sighted object: unidentified flying object with a pear shape and soft white light
